verses.en: So they took away the stone. Then Jesus looked up and said, Father, I thank you that you have heard me.

verses.zh: 我也知道你常听我，但我说这话是为周围站着的众人，叫他们信是你差了我来。
verses.en: I knew that you always hear me, but I said this for the benefit of the people standing here, that they may believe that you sent me.

verses.zh: 说了这话，就大声呼叫说：拉撒路出来！
verses.en: When he had said this, Jesus called in a loud voice, Lazarus, come out!

verses.zh: 那死人就出来了，手脚裹着布，脸上也包着手巾。耶稣对他们说：解开，叫他走。
verses.en: The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped with strips of linen, and a cloth around his face. Jesus said to them, Take off the grave clothes and let him go.

verses.zh: 有好些来到马利亚那里的犹太人，见了耶稣所作的事，就信了他。
verses.en: Therefore many of the Jews who had come to visit Mary, and had seen what Jesus did, believed in him.

verses.zh: 但其中也有去见法利赛人的，将耶稣所作的事告诉他们。
verses.en: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.

verses.zh: 祭司长和法利赛人聚集公会，说：这人行好些神迹，我们怎么办呢？
verses.en: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees called a meeting of the Sanhedrin. What are we accomplishing? they asked. Here is this man performing many signs.

verses.zh: 若这样由着他，人人都要信他，罗马人也要来夺我们的地土和我们的百姓。
verses.en: If we let him go on like this, everyone will believe in him, and then the Romans will come and take away both our temple and our nation.

verses.zh: 内中有一个人，名叫该亚法，本年作大祭司，对他们说：你们不知道什么。
verses.en: Then one of them, named Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, spoke up, You know nothing at all!

verses.zh: 独不想一个人替百姓死，免得通国灭亡，就是你们的益处。
verses.en: You do not realize that it is better for you that one man die for the people than that the whole nation perish.

verses.zh: 他这话不是出于自己，是因他本年作大祭司，所以预言耶稣将要替这一国死。
verses.en: He did not say this on his own, but as high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the Jewish nation,

verses.zh: 也不但替这一国死，并要将神四散的子民都聚集归一。
verses.en: and not only for that nation but also for the scattered children of God, to bring them together and make them one.

verses.zh: 从那日起，他们就商议要杀耶稣。
verses.en: So from that day on they plotted to take his life.

verses.zh: 所以耶稣不再显然行在犹太人中间，就离开那里往靠近旷野的地方去，到了一座城，名叫以法莲，就在那里和门徒同住。
verses.en: Therefore Jesus no longer moved about publicly among the people of Judea. Instead he withdrew to a region near the wilderness, to a village called Ephraim, where he stayed with his disciples.

verses.zh: 犹太人的逾越节近了，有许多人从乡下上耶路撒冷去，要在节前洁净自己。
verses.en: When it was almost time for the Jewish Passover, many went up from the country to Jerusalem for their ceremonial cleansing before the Passover.

verses.zh: 他们就寻找耶稣，站在殿里彼此说：你们的意思如何，他不来过节吗？
verses.en: They kept looking for Jesus, and as they stood in the temple courts they asked one another, What do you think? Isn't he coming to the festival at all?

verses.zh: 祭司长和法利赛人早已吩咐说：若有人知道耶稣在哪里，就要报明，好去捉拿他。
verses.en: But the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that anyone who found out where Jesus was should report it so that they might arrest him.

verses.zh: 逾越节前六日，耶稣来到伯大尼，就是他叫拉撒路从死里复活的地方。
verses.en: Six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus lived, whom Jesus had raised from the dead.

verses.zh: 有人在那里给耶稣预备筵席，马大伺候，拉撒路也在那同耶稣坐席的人中。
verses.en: Here a dinner was given in Jesus' honor. Martha served, while Lazarus was among those reclining at the table with him.

verses.zh: 马利亚就拿着一斤极贵的真哪哒香膏，抹耶稣的脚，又用自己的头发擦干；屋里就满了膏的香气。
verses.en: Then Mary took about a pint of pure nard, an expensive perfume; she poured it on Jesus' feet and wiped his feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.

verses.zh: 有一个门徒，就是那将要卖耶稣的加略人犹大，
verses.en: But one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, who was later to betray him, objected,

verses.zh: 说：这香膏为什么不卖三十两银子周济穷人呢？
verses.en: Why wasn't this perfume sold and the money given to the poor? It was worth a year's wages.

verses.zh: 他说这话，不是因为挂念穷人，乃因为他是贼，又带着钱囊，常取其中所存的。
verses.en: He did not say this because he cared about the poor but because he was a thief; as keeper of the money bag, he used to help himself to what was put into it.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：由她吧，她是为我安葬之日存留的。
verses.en: Leave her alone, Jesus replied. It was intended that she should save this perfume for the day of my burial.

verses.zh: 因为常有穷人和你们同在，只是你们不常有我。
verses.en: You will always have the poor among you, but you will not always have me.

verses.zh: 有许多犹太人知道耶稣在那里，就来了，不但是为耶稣的缘故，也是要看他从死里所复活的拉撒路。
verses.en: Meanwhile a large crowd of Jews found out that Jesus was there and came, not only because of him but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.

verses.zh: 但祭司长商议，连拉撒路也要杀了，
verses.en: So the chief priests made plans to kill Lazarus as well,

verses.zh: 因有好些犹太人，为拉撒路的缘故，回去信了耶稣。
verses.en: for on account of him many of the Jews were going over to Jesus and believing in him.

verses.zh: 第二天，有许多上来过节的人，听见耶稣将到耶路撒冷，
verses.en: The next day the great crowd that had come for the festival heard that Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 就拿着棕树枝，出去迎接他，喊着说：和散那！奉主名来的以色列王，是应当称颂的！
verses.en: They took palm branches and went out to meet him, shouting, Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Blessed is the king of Israel!

verses.zh: 耶稣得了一个驴驹，就骑上，如经上所记：
verses.en: Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it, as it is written:

verses.zh: 锡安的居民哪，不要惧怕，你的王骑着驴驹来了。
verses.en: Do not be afraid, Daughter Zion; see, your king is coming, seated on a donkey's colt.

verses.zh: 这些事门徒起先不明白，等到耶稣得了荣耀以后，才想起这话是指着他写的，并且众人果然向他这样行了。
verses.en: At first his disciples did not understand all this. Only after Jesus was glorified did they realize that these things had been written about him and that these things had been done to him.

verses.zh: 当耶稣呼唤拉撒路，叫他从坟墓出来，从死里复活的时候，同耶稣在那里的众人就作见证。
verses.en: Now the crowd that was with him when he called Lazarus from the tomb and raised him from the dead continued to spread the word.

verses.zh: 众人因听见耶稣行了这个神迹，就去迎接他。
verses.en: Many people, because they had heard that he had performed this sign, went out to meet him.

verses.zh: 法利赛人彼此说：看哪，你们是徒劳无益，世人都随从他去了。
verses.en: So the Pharisees said to one another, See, this is getting us nowhere. Look how the whole world has gone after him!

verses.zh: 那时，上来过节礼拜的人中，有几个希腊人。
verses.en: Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the festival.

verses.zh: 他们来见加利利的伯赛大人腓力，求他说：先生，我们愿意见耶稣。
verses.en: They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, with a request. Sir, they said, we would like to see Jesus.

verses.zh: 腓力去告诉安得烈，安得烈同腓力去告诉耶稣。
verses.en: Philip went to tell Andrew; Andrew and Philip in turn told Jesus.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：人子得荣耀的时候到了。
verses.en: Jesus replied, The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.

verses.zh: 我实实在在地告诉你们，一粒麦子不落在地里死了，仍旧是一粒，若死了，就结出许多子粒来。
verses.en: Very truly I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains just a single seed. But if it dies, it produces many seeds.

verses.zh: 爱惜自己生命的，就失丧生命；在今世恨恶自己生命的，就要保守生命到永生。
verses.en: Anyone who loves their life will lose it, while anyone who hates their life in this world will keep it for eternal life.

verses.zh: 若有人服侍我，就当跟从我；我在哪里，服侍我的人也要在那里；若有人服侍我，我父必尊重他。
verses.en: Whoever serves me must follow me; and where I am, my servant also will be. My Father will honor the one who serves me.

verses.zh: 现在我心里忧愁，我说什么才好呢？父啊，救我脱离这时候；但我原是为这时候来的。
verses.en: Now my soul is troubled, and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour? No, it was for this very reason I came to this hour.

verses.zh: 父啊，愿你荣耀你的名！当时就有声音从天上来，说：我已经荣耀了我的名，还要再荣耀。
verses.en: Father, glorify your name! Then a voice came from heaven, I have glorified it, and will glorify it again.

verses.zh: 站在旁边的众人听见，就说：打雷了。还有人说：有天使对他说话。
verses.en: The crowd that was there and heard it said it had thundered; others said an angel had spoken to him.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：这声音不是为我，是为你们来的。
verses.en: Jesus said, This voice was for your benefit, not mine.

verses.zh: 现在这世界受审判，这世界的王要被赶出去。
verses.en: Now is the time for judgment on this world; now the prince of this world will be driven out.

verses.zh: 我若从地上被举起来，就要吸引万人来归我。
verses.en: And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.

verses.zh: 他说这话，是指着自己将要怎样死说的。
verses.en: He said this to show the kind of death he was going to die.

verses.zh: 众人回答说：我们听见律法上有话说，基督是永存的，你怎么说人子必须被举起来呢？这人子是谁？
verses.en: The crowd spoke up, We have heard from the Law that the Messiah will remain forever, so how can you say, 'The Son of Man must be lifted up'? Who is this 'Son of Man'?

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：光在你们中间还有不多的时候，应当趁着有光行走，免得黑暗临到你们；那在黑暗里行走的，不知道往何处去。
verses.en: Then Jesus told them, You are going to have the light just a little while longer. Walk while you have the light, before darkness overtakes you. Whoever walks in the dark does not know where they are going.

verses.zh: 你们应当趁着有光，信从这光，使你们成为光明之子。耶稣说了这话，就离开他们，隐藏了。
verses.en: Believe in the light while you have the light, so that you may become children of light. When he had finished speaking, Jesus left and hid himself from them.

verses.zh: 他虽然在他们面前行了许多神迹，他们还是不信他。
verses.en: Even after Jesus had performed so many signs in their presence, they still would not believe in him.

verses.zh: 这是要应验先知以赛亚的话，说：主啊，我们所传的有谁信呢？主的膀臂向谁显露呢？
verses.en: This was to fulfill the word of Isaiah the prophet: Lord, who has believed our message and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?

verses.zh: 他们所以不能信，因为以赛亚又说：
verses.en: For this reason they could not believe, because, as Isaiah says elsewhere:

verses.zh: 主叫他们瞎了眼，硬了心，免得他们眼睛看见，心里明白，回转过来，我就医治他们。
verses.en: He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, so they can neither see with their eyes, nor understand with their hearts, nor turn—and I would heal them.

verses.zh: 以赛亚因为看见他的荣耀，就指着他说了这话。
verses.en: Isaiah said this because he saw Jesus' glory and spoke about him.

verses.zh: 然而，官长中竟有好些信他的，只因法利赛人的缘故，不肯承认，恐怕被赶出会堂。
verses.en: Yet at the same time many even among the leaders believed in him. But because of the Pharisees they would not openly acknowledge their faith for fear they would be put out of the synagogue;

verses.zh: 这是因为他们爱人的荣耀过于爱神的荣耀。
verses.en: for they loved human praise more than praise from God.

verses.zh: 耶稣大声说：信我的，不是信我，乃是信那差我来的。
verses.en: Then Jesus cried out, Whoever believes in me does not believe in me only, but in the one who sent me.

verses.zh: 人看见我，就是看见那差我来的。
verses.en: The one who looks at me is seeing the one who sent me.

verses.zh: 我到世上来，乃是光，叫凡信我的，不住在黑暗里。
verses.en: I have come into the world as a light, so that no one who believes in me should stay in darkness.

verses.zh: 若有人听见我的话不遵守，我不审判他；我来本不是要审判世界，乃是要拯救世界。
verses.en: If anyone hears my words but does not keep them, I do not judge that person. For I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.

verses.zh: 弃绝我、不领受我话的人，有审判他的，就是我所讲的话在末日要审判他。
verses.en: There is a judge for the one who rejects me and does not accept my words; the very words I have spoken will condemn them at the last day.

verses.zh: 因为我并没有凭着自己讲，惟有差我来的父，已经给我 commandment，叫我说什么，讲什么。
verses.en: For I did not speak on my own, but the Father who sent me commanded me to say all that I have spoken.

verses.zh: 我知道他的 commandment 就是永生。故此，我所讲的话，正是照着父对我所说的。
verses.en: I know that his command leads to eternal life. So whatever I say is just what the Father has told me to say.

verses.zh: 逾越节以前，耶稣知道自己离世归父的时候到了。他既然爱世间属自己的人，就爱他们到底。
verses.en: It was just before the Passover Festival. Jesus knew that the hour had come for him to leave this world and go to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.

verses.zh: 吃晚饭的时候，魔鬼已将卖耶稣的意思放在西门的儿子加略人犹大心里。
verses.en: The evening meal was in progress, and the devil had already prompted Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, to betray Jesus.

verses.zh: 耶稣知道父已将万有交在他手里，且知道自己是从神出来的，又要归到神那里去，
verses.en: Jesus knew that the Father had put all things under his power, and that he had come from God and was returning to God;

verses.zh: 就离席站起来，脱了衣服，拿一条手巾束腰。
verses.en: so he got up from the meal, took off his outer clothing, and wrapped a towel around his waist.

verses.zh: 随后把水倒在盆里，开始洗门徒的脚，并用自己所束的手巾擦干。
verses.en: After that, he poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples' feet, drying them with the towel that was wrapped around him.

verses.zh: 挨到西门彼得，彼得对他说：主啊，你洗我的脚吗？
verses.en: He came to Simon Peter, who said to him, Lord, are you going to wash my feet?

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：我所作的，你如今不知道，后来必明白。
verses.en: Jesus replied, You do not realize now what I am doing, but later you will understand.

verses.zh: 彼得说：你永不可洗我的脚！耶稣说：我若不洗你，你就与我无分了。
verses.en: No, said Peter, you shall never wash my feet. Jesus answered, Unless I wash you, you have no part with me.

verses.zh: 西门彼得说：主啊，不但我的脚，连手和头也要洗。
verses.en: Then, Lord, not just my feet but my hands and my head as well! said Simon Peter.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：凡洗过澡的人，只要把脚一洗，全身就干净了。你们是干净的，然而不都是干净的。
verses.en: Jesus answered, Those who have had a bath need only to wash their feet; their whole body is clean. And you are clean, though not every one of you.

verses.zh: 耶稣原知道谁要卖他，所以说：你们不都是干净的。
verses.en: For he knew who was going to betray him, and that was why he said not every one was clean.

verses.zh: 耶稣洗完了他们的脚，就穿上衣服，又坐下，对他们说：我向你们所作的，你们明白吗？
verses.en: When he had finished washing their feet, he put on his clothes and returned to his place. Do you understand what I have done for you? he asked them.

verses.zh: 你们称呼我夫子，称呼主，你们说的不错，我本来是。
verses.en: You call me 'Teacher' and 'Lord,' and rightly so, for that is what I am.

verses.zh: 我是你们的主，你们的夫子，尚且洗你们的脚，你们也当彼此洗脚。
verses.en: Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another's feet.

verses.zh: 我给你们作了榜样，叫你们照着我向你们所作的去作。
verses.en: I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

verses.zh: 我实实在在地告诉你们，仆人不能大于主人，差人也不能大于差他的人。
verses.en: Very truly I tell you, no servant is greater than his master, nor is a messenger greater than the one who sent him.

verses.zh: 你们既知道这事，若是去行就有福了。
verses.en: Now that you know these things, you will be blessed if you do them.

verses.zh: 我这话不是指着你们众人说的，我知道我所拣选的是谁。现在要应验经上的话，说：同我吃饭的人，用脚踢我。
verses.en: I am not referring to all of you; I know those I have chosen. But this is to fulfill this passage of Scripture: 'He who shared my bread has turned against me.'

verses.zh: 如今事情还没有成就，我预先告诉你们，叫你们到事情成就的时候，可以信我是基督。
verses.en: I am telling you now before it happens, so that when it does happen you will believe that I am who I am.

verses.zh: 我实实在在地告诉你们，有人接待我所差遣的，就是接待我；接待我，就是接待那差遣我的。
verses.en: Very truly I tell you, whoever accepts anyone I send accepts me; and whoever accepts me accepts the one who sent me.

verses.zh: 耶稣说了这话，心里忧愁，就明说：我实实在在地告诉你们，你们中间有一个人要卖我了。
verses.en: After he had said this, Jesus was troubled in spirit and testified, Very truly I tell you, one of you is going to betray me.

verses.zh: 门徒彼此对看，猜不透所说的是谁。
verses.en: His disciples stared at one another, at a loss to know which of them he meant.

verses.zh: 有一个门徒，是耶稣所爱的，侧身挨近耶稣的怀里。
verses.en: One of them, the disciple whom Jesus loved, was reclining next to him.

verses.zh: 西门彼得点头对他说：你问问主是指着谁说的。
verses.en: Simon Peter motioned to this disciple and said, Ask him which one he means.

verses.zh: 那门徒就便身挨近耶稣的胸膛，问他说：主啊，是谁呢？
verses.en: Leaning back against Jesus, he asked him, Lord, who is it?

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：我蘸一点饼给谁，就是谁。耶稣就蘸了一点饼，递给加略人西门的儿子犹大。
verses.en: Jesus answered, It is the one to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it in the dish. Then, dipping the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

verses.zh: 他吃了以后，撒但就入了他的心。耶稣便对他说：你所作的快作吧。
verses.en: As soon as Judas took the bread, Satan entered into him. So Jesus told him, What you are about to do, do quickly.

verses.zh: 同席的人，没有一个知道是为什么对他说这话的。
verses.en: But no one at the meal understood why Jesus said this to him.

verses.zh: 有人以为耶稣对犹大说：你去买过节所应用的东西，或是叫他拿什么周济穷人。
verses.en: Since Judas had charge of the money, some thought Jesus was telling him to buy what was needed for the festival, or to give something to the poor.

verses.zh: 犹大受了那点饼，立刻就出去。那时候是夜间了。
verses.en: As soon as Judas had taken the bread, he went out. And it was night.

verses.zh: 他既出去，耶稣就说：如今人子得了荣耀，神在人子身上也得了荣耀。
verses.en: When he was gone, Jesus said, Now the Son of Man is glorified and God is glorified in him.

verses.zh: 神若在人子身上得了荣耀，他的神也要在自己身上荣耀人子，并且要快快地荣耀他。
verses.en: If God is glorified in him, God will glorify the Son in himself, and will glorify him at once.

verses.zh: 小子们，我还有不多的时候与你们同在。后来你们要找我，但我所去的地方，你们不能到。这话我曾对犹太人说过，如今也照样对你们说。
verses.en: My children, I will be with you only a little longer. You will look for me, and just as I told the Jews, so I tell you now: Where I am going, you cannot come.

verses.zh: 我赐给你们一条新 commandment，乃是叫你们彼此相爱；我怎样爱你们，你们也要怎样相爱。
verses.en: A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.

verses.zh: 你们若有彼此相爱的心，众人因此就认出你们是我的门徒了。
verses.en: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another.

verses.zh: 西门彼得问耶稣说：主往哪里去？耶稣回答说：我所去的地方，你现在不能跟我去，后来却要跟我去。
verses.en: Simon Peter asked him, Lord, where are you going? Jesus replied, Where I am going, you cannot follow now, but you will follow later.

verses.zh: 彼得说：主啊，我为什么现在不能跟你去？我愿意为你舍命。
verses.en: Peter asked, Lord, why can't I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：你愿意为我舍命吗？我实实在在地告诉你，鸡叫以前，你要三次不认我。
verses.en: Then Jesus answered, Will you really lay down your life for me? Very truly I tell you, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times!

verses.zh: 你们心里不要忧愁；你们信神，也当信我。
verses.en: Do not let your hearts be troubled. You believe in God; believe also in me.

verses.zh: 在我父的家里，有许多住处；若是没有，我就早已告诉你们了。我去原是为你们预备地方去。
verses.en: My Father's house has many rooms; if that were not so, would I have told you that I am going there to prepare a place for you?

verses.zh: 我若去为你们预备了地方，就必再来接你们到我那里去，我在哪里，叫你们也在那里。
verses.en: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back and take you to be with me that you also may be where I am.

verses.zh: 我往哪里去，你们知道；那条路，你们也知道。
verses.en: You know the way to the place where I am going.

verses.zh: 多马对他说：主啊，我们不知道你往哪里去，怎么知道那条路呢？
verses.en: Thomas said to him, Lord, we don't know where you are going, so how can we know the way?

verses.zh: 耶稣说：我就是道路、真理、生命；若不借着我，没有人能到父那里去。
verses.en: Jesus answered, I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

verses.zh: 你们若认识我，也就认识我的父。从今以后，你们认识他，并且已经看见他。
verses.en: If you really know me, you will know my Father as well. From now on, you do know him and have seen him.

verses.zh: 腓力对他说：求主将父显给我们看，我们就知足了。
verses.en: Philip said, Lord, show us the Father and that will be enough for us.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：腓力，我与你们同在这样长久，你还不认识我吗？人看见了我，就是看见了父；你怎么说将父显给我们看呢？
verses.en: Jesus answered: Don't you know me, Philip, even after I have been among you such a long time? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, 'Show us the Father'?

verses.zh: 我在父里面，父在我里面，你不信吗？我对你们所说的话，不是凭着自己说的，乃是住在我里面的父作他自己的事。
verses.en: Don't you believe that I am in the Father, and that the Father is in me? The words I say to you I do not speak on my own authority. Rather, it is the Father, living in me, who is doing his work.

verses.zh: 你们当信我，我在父里面，父在我里面；即或不信，也当因我所作的事信我。
verses.en: Believe me when I say that I am in the Father and the Father is in me; or at least believe on the evidence of the works themselves.

verses.zh: 我实实在在地告诉你们，我所作的事，信我的人也要作，并且要作比这更大的事，因为我往父那里去。
verses.en: Very truly I tell you, whoever believes in me will do the works I have been doing, and they will do even greater things than these, because I am going to the Father.

verses.zh: 你们奉我的名无论求什么，我必成就，叫父因儿子得荣耀。
verses.en: And I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

verses.zh: 你们若奉我的名求什么，我必成就。
verses.en: You may ask me for anything in my name, and I will do it.

verses.zh: 你们若爱我，就必遵守我的 commandment。
verses.en: If you love me, keep my commands.

verses.zh: 我要求父，父就另外赐给你们一位保惠师，叫他永远与你们同在，
verses.en: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another advocate to help you and be with you forever—

verses.zh: 就是真理的圣灵，乃世人不能接受的；因为不见他，也不认识他。你们却认识他，因他常与你们同在，也要在你们里面。
verses.en: the Spirit of truth. The world cannot accept him, because it neither sees him nor knows him. But you know him, for he lives with you and will be in you.

verses.zh: 我不撇下你们为孤儿，我必到你们这里来。
verses.en: I will not leave you as orphans; I will come to you.

verses.zh: 还有不多的时候，世人不再看见我，你们却看见我，因为我活着，你们也要活着。
verses.en: Before long, the world will not see me anymore, but you will see me. Because I live, you also will live.

verses.zh: 到那日，你们就知道我在父里面，你们在我里面，我也在你们里面。
verses.en: On that day you will realize that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.

verses.zh: 有了我的 commandment 又遵守的，这人就是爱我的；爱我的必蒙我父爱他，我也要爱他，并且要向他显现。
verses.en: Whoever has my commands and keeps them is the one who loves me. The one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I too will love them and show myself to them.

verses.zh: 犹大（不是加略人犹大）问耶稣说：主啊，为什么要向我们显现，不向世人显现呢？
verses.en: Then Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, But, Lord, why do you intend to show yourself to us and not to the world?

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：人若爱我，就必遵守我的道；我父也必爱他，并且我们要到他那里去，与他同住。
verses.en: Jesus replied, Anyone who loves me will obey my teaching. My Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.

verses.zh: 不爱我的人就不遵守我的道。你们所听见的道不是我的，乃是差我来之父的道。
verses.en: Anyone who does not love me will not obey my teaching. These words you hear are not my own; they belong to the Father who sent me.

verses.zh: 我还与你们同住的时候，已将这些话对你们说了。
verses.en: All this I have spoken while still with you.

verses.zh: 但保惠师，就是父因我的名所要差来的圣灵，他要将一切的事指教你们，并且要叫你们想起我对你们所说的一切话。
verses.en: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and will remind you of everything I have said to you.

verses.zh: 我留下平安给你们；我将我的平安赐给你们。我所赐的，不像世人所赐的。你们心里不要忧愁，也不要胆怯。
verses.en: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.

verses.zh: 你们听见我对你们说了，我去还要到你们这里来。你们若爱我，因我到父那里去就必喜乐，因为父是比我大的。
verses.en: You heard me say, 'I am going away and I am coming back to you.' If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.

verses.zh: 现在事情还没有成就，我预先告诉你们，叫你们到事情成就的时候就可以信。
verses.en: I have told you now before it happens, so that when it does happen you will believe.

verses.zh: 以后我不再和你们多说话，因为这世界的王将到。他在我里面是毫无所有，
verses.en: I will not say much more to you, for the prince of this world is coming. He has no hold over me,

verses.zh: 但要叫世人知道我爱父，并且父怎样吩咐我，我就怎样行。起来，我们走吧！
verses.en: but he comes so that the world may learn that I love the Father and do exactly what my Father has commanded me. Come now; let us leave.

verses.zh: 我是真葡萄树，我父是栽培的人。
verses.en: I am the true vine, and my Father is the gardener.

verses.zh: 凡属我不结果子的枝子，他就剪去；凡结果子的，他就修理干净，使枝子结果子更多。
verses.en: He cuts off every branch in me that bears no fruit, while every branch that does bear fruit he prunes so that it will be even more fruitful.

verses.zh: 现在你们因我讲给你们的道，已经干净了。
verses.en: You are already clean because of the word I have spoken to you.

verses.zh: 你们要常在我里面，我也常在你们里面。枝子若不常在葡萄树上，自己就不能结果子；你们若不常在我里面，也是这样。
verses.en: Remain in me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in me.

verses.zh: 我是葡萄树，你们是枝子。常在我里面的，我也常在他里面，这人就多结果子；因为离了我，你们就不能作什么。
verses.en: I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.

verses.zh: 人若不常在我里面，就像枝子丢在外面枯干，人拾起来，扔在火里烧了。
verses.en: If you do not remain in me, you are like a branch that is thrown away and withers; such branches are picked up, thrown into the fire and burned.

verses.zh: 你们若常在我里面，我的话也常在你们里面，凡你们所愿意的，祈求就给你们成就。
verses.en: If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.

verses.zh: 你们多结果子，我父就因此得荣耀，你们也就是我的门徒了。
verses.en: This is to my Father's glory, that you bear much fruit, showing yourselves to be my disciples.

verses.zh: 我爱你们，正如父爱我一样；你们要常在我的爱里。
verses.en: As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you. Now remain in my love.

verses.zh: 你们若遵守我的 commandment，就常在我的爱里，正如我遵守了我父的 commandment，常在父的爱里。
verses.en: If you keep my commands, you will remain in my love, just as I have kept my Father's commands and remain in his love.

verses.zh: 这些事我已经对你们说了，是要叫我的喜乐存在你们心里，并叫你们的喜乐可以满足。
verses.en: I have told you this so that my joy may be in you and that your joy may be complete.

verses.zh: 你们要彼此相爱，像我爱你们一样，这就是我的 commandment。
verses.en: My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you.

verses.zh: 人为朋友舍命，人的爱心没有比这个大的。
verses.en: Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one's life for one's friends.

verses.zh: 你们若遵行我所吩咐的，就是我的朋友了。
verses.en: You are my friends if you do what I command.

verses.zh: 以后我不再称你们为仆人，因仆人不知道主人所作的事。我乃称你们为朋友，因我从父所听见的，已经都告诉你们了。
verses.en: I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master's business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from my Father I have made known to you.

verses.zh: 不是你们拣选了我，是我拣选了你们，并且分派你们去结果子，叫你们的果子常存，使你们奉我的名，无论向父求什么，他就赐给你们。
verses.en: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you so that you might go and bear fruit—fruit that will last—and so that whatever you ask in my name the Father will give you.

verses.zh: 我将这些事吩咐你们，是要叫你们彼此相爱。
verses.en: This is my command: Love each other.

verses.zh: 世人若恨你们，你们知道恨你们以先，已经恨我了。
verses.en: If the world hates you, keep in mind that it hated me first.

verses.zh: 你们若属世界，世界必爱属自己的；只因你们不属世界，乃是我从世界中拣选了你们，所以世界就恨你们。
verses.en: If you belonged to the world, it would love you as its own. As it is, you do not belong to the world, but I have chosen you out of the world. That is why the world hates you.

verses.zh: 你们要记念我从前对你们所说的话：仆人不能大于主人。他们若逼迫了我，也要逼迫你们；若遵守了我的话，也要遵守你们的话。
verses.en: Remember what I told you: 'A servant is not greater than his master.' If they persecuted me, they will persecute you also. If they obeyed my teaching, they will obey yours also.

verses.zh: 但他们因我的名要向你们行这一切的事，因为他们不认识那差我来的。
verses.en: They will treat you this way because of my name, for they do not know the one who sent me.

verses.zh: 我若没有来教训他们，他们就没有罪；但如今他们的罪无可推诿了。
verses.en: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

verses.zh: 恨我的，也恨我的父。
verses.en: Whoever hates me hates my Father as well.

verses.zh: 我若没有在他们中间行过别人未曾行的事，他们就没有罪；但如今连我与我的父，他们也看见也恨恶了。
verses.en: If I had not done among them the works no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. As it is, they have seen, and yet they have hated both me and my Father.

verses.zh: 这要应验他们律法上所写的话，说：他们无故地恨我。
verses.en: But this is to fulfill what is written in their Law: 'They hated me without reason.'

verses.zh: 但我要从父那里差保惠师来，就是从父出来真理的圣灵；他来了，就要为我作见证。
verses.en: When the Advocate comes, whom I will send to you from the Father—the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father—he will testify about me.

verses.zh: 你们也要作见证，因为你们从起初就与我同在。
verses.en: And you also must testify, for you have been with me from the beginning.

verses.zh: 我已将这些事告诉你们，使你们不至于跌倒。
verses.en: All this I have told you so that you will not fall away.

verses.zh: 人要把你们赶出会堂，并且时候将到，凡杀你们的，就以为是事奉神。
verses.en: They will put you out of the synagogue; in fact, the time is coming when anyone who kills you will think they are offering a service to God.

verses.zh: 他们这样行，是因未曾认识父，也未曾认识我。
verses.en: They will do such things because they have not known the Father or me.

verses.zh: 我将这些事告诉你们，是叫你们到了时候，可以想起我对你们说过了。我起初没有将这些事告诉你们，因为我与你们同在。
verses.en: I have told you this, so that when their time comes you will remember that I warned you about them. I did not tell you this from the beginning because I was with you,

verses.zh: 现在我往差我来的父那里去，你们中间并没有人问我：你往哪里去？
verses.en: but now I am going to him who sent me. None of you asks me, 'Where are you going?'

verses.zh: 只因我将这事告诉你们，你们就满心忧愁。
verses.en: Rather, you are filled with grief because I have said these things.

verses.zh: 然而我将真情告诉你们，我去是与你们有益的；我若不去，保惠师就不到你们这里来；我若去，就差他来。
verses.en: But very truly I tell you, it is for your good that I am going away. Unless I go away, the Advocate will not come to you; but if I go, I will send him to you.

verses.zh: 他来了，就要叫世人为罪、为义、为审判，自己责备自己。
verses.en: When he comes, he will prove the world to be in the wrong about sin and righteousness and judgment:

verses.zh: 为罪，是因他们不信我；
verses.en: about sin, because people do not believe in me;

verses.zh: 为义，是因我往父那里去，你们就不再见我；
verses.en: about righteousness, because I am going to the Father, where you can see me no longer;

verses.zh: 为审判，是因这世界的王受了审判。
verses.en: and about judgment, because the prince of this world now stands condemned.

verses.zh: 我还有好些事要告诉你们，但你们现在担当不了。
verses.en: I have much more to say to you, more than you can now bear.

verses.zh: 只等真理的圣灵来了，他要引导你们明白一切的真理；因为他不是凭自己说的，乃是把他所听见的都说出来，并要把将来的事告诉你们。
verses.en: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come.

verses.zh: 他要荣耀我，因为他要将受于我的告诉你们。
verses.en: He will glorify me because it is from me that he will receive what he will make known to you.

verses.zh: 一切所有乃是父的，所以他受于父的，也要告诉你们。
verses.en: All that belongs to the Father is mine. That is why I said the Spirit will receive from me what he will make known to you.

verses.zh: 等不多时，你们就不得见我；再等不多时，你们还要见我。
verses.en: Jesus went on to say, In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me again.

verses.zh: 有几个门徒就彼此说：他对我们说：等不多时，你们就不得见我；再等不多时，你们还要见我；又说：因我往父那里去。究竟是什么意思呢？
verses.en: At this, some of his disciples said to one another, What does he mean by saying, 'In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me again,' and 'Because I am going to the Father'?

verses.zh: 他们继续说：他说等不多时，到底是什么意思呢？我们不明白他所说的话。
verses.en: They kept asking, What does he mean by 'a little while'? We don't understand what he is saying.

verses.zh: 耶稣看出他们要问他，就说：我说等不多时，你们就不得见我；再等不多时，你们还要见我，你们是为这话彼此相问吗？
verses.en: Jesus saw that they wanted to ask him about this, so he said to them, Are you asking one another what I meant when I said, 'In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me again'?

verses.zh: 我实实在在地告诉你们，你们将要痛哭、哀号，世人倒要喜乐；你们将要忧愁，然而你们的忧愁要变为喜乐。
verses.en: Very truly I tell you, you will weep and mourn while the world rejoices. You will grieve, but your grief will turn to joy.

verses.zh: 妇人生产的时候，就忧愁，因为他的时候到了；既生了孩子，就不再记念那苦楚，因为欢喜世上生了一个人。
verses.en: A woman giving birth to a child has pain because her time has come; but when her baby is born she forgets the anguish because of her joy that a child is born into the world.

verses.zh: 你们现在也是忧愁，但我要再见你们，你们的心就喜乐了；这喜乐也没有人能夺去。
verses.en: So with you: Now is your time of grief, but I will see you again and you will rejoice, and no one will take away your joy.

verses.zh: 到那日，你们什么也不问我了。我实实在在地告诉你们，你们若向父求什么，他必因我的名赐给你们。
verses.en: In that day you will no longer ask me anything. Very truly I tell you, my Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.

verses.zh: 向来你们没有奉我的名求什么，如今你们求就必得着，叫你们的喜乐可以满足。
verses.en: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, and your joy will be complete.

verses.zh: 这些事，我是用比喻对你们说的；时候将到，我不再用比喻对你们说，乃要将父明明地告诉你们。
verses.en: Though I have been speaking figuratively, a time is coming when I will no longer use this kind of language but will tell you plainly about my Father.

verses.zh: 到那日，你们要奉我的名祈求；我并不对你们说，我要为你们求父。
verses.en: In that day you will ask in my name. I am not saying that I will ask the Father on your behalf.

verses.zh: 父自己爱你们，因为你们已经爱我，又信我是从父出来的。
verses.en: No, the Father himself loves you because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.

verses.zh: 我从父出来，到了世界；我又离开世界，往父那里去。
verses.en: I came from the Father and entered the world; now I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.

verses.zh: 门徒说：如今你是明明的说话，并不用比喻。
verses.en: Then Jesus' disciples said, Now you are speaking clearly and without figures of speech.

verses.zh: 现在我们知道，你凡事都知道，也不用人问你，因此我们信你是从神出来的。
verses.en: Now we can see that you know all things and that you do not even need to have anyone ask you questions. This makes us believe that you came from God.

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：现在你们信吗？
verses.en: Do you now believe? he replied.

verses.zh: 看哪，时候将到，且是已经到了，你们要分散，各归自己的地方去，留下我独自一人；其实我不是独自一人，因为有父与我同在。
verses.en: A time is coming and in fact has come when you will be scattered, each to your own home. You will leave me all alone. Yet I am not alone, for my Father is with me.

verses.zh: 我将这些事告诉你们，是要叫你们在我里面有平安。在世上你们有苦难，但你们可以放心，我已经胜了世界。
verses.en: I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.

verses.zh: 耶稣说了这话，就举目望天，说：父啊，时候到了，愿你荣耀你的儿子，使儿子也荣耀你；
verses.en: After Jesus said this, he looked toward heaven and prayed: Father, the hour has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may glorify you.

verses.zh: 正如你曾赐给他权柄管理凡有血气的，叫他将永生赐给你所赐给他的人。
verses.en: For you granted him authority over all people that he might give eternal life to all those you have given him.

verses.zh: 认识你独一的真神，并且认识你所差来的耶稣基督，这就是永生。
verses.en: Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.

verses.zh: 我在地上已经荣耀你，你所托付我的事，我已成全了。
verses.en: I have brought you glory on earth by finishing the work you gave me to do.

verses.zh: 父啊，现在求你使我同你享荣耀，就是未有世界以先，我同你所有的荣耀。
verses.en: And now, Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world began.

verses.zh: 你从世上赐给我的人，我已将你的名显明与他们。他们本是你的，你将他们赐给我，他们也遵守了你的道。
verses.en: I have revealed you to those whom you gave me out of the world. They were yours; you gave them to me and they have obeyed your word.

verses.zh: 如今他们知道，凡你所赐给我的，都是从你那里来的；
verses.en: Now they know that everything you have given me comes from you.

verses.zh: 因为你所赐给我的道，我已经给了他们，他们也领受了，又确实知道，我是从你出来的，并且信你差了我来。
verses.en: For I gave them the words you gave me and they accepted them. They knew with certainty that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.

verses.zh: 我为他们祈求，不为世人祈求，却为你所赐给我的人祈求，因他们本是你的。
verses.en: I pray for them. I am not praying for the world, but for those you have given me, for they are yours.

verses.zh: 凡是我的，都是你的；你的，也是我的，并且我因他们得了荣耀。
verses.en: All I have is yours, and all you have is mine. And glory has come to me through them.

verses.zh: 从今以后，我不在世上，他们却在世上；我往你那里去。圣父啊，求你因你所赐给我的名保守他们，叫他们合而为一像我们一样。
verses.en: I will remain in the world no longer, but they are still in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them by the power of your name, the name you gave me, so that they may be one as we are one.

verses.zh: 我与他们同在的时候，因你所赐给我的名保守了他们，我也护卫了他们；其中除了那灭亡之子，没有一个灭亡的，好叫经上的话得应验。
verses.en: While I was with them, I protected them and kept them safe by that name you gave me. None has been lost except the one doomed to destruction so that Scripture would be fulfilled.

verses.zh: 现在我往你那里去，我还在世上说这话，是叫他们心里充满我的喜乐。
verses.en: I am coming to you now, but I say these things while I am still in the world, so that they may have the full measure of my joy within them.

verses.zh: 我已将你的道赐给他们。世界又恨他们，因为他们不属世界，正如我不属世界一样。
verses.en: I have given them your word and the world has hated them, for they are not of the world any more than I am of the world.

verses.zh: 我不求你叫他们离开世界，只求你保守他们脱离那恶者。
verses.en: My prayer is not that you take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.

verses.zh: 他们不属世界，正如我不属世界一样。
verses.en: They are not of the world, even as I am not of it.

verses.zh: 求你用真理使他们成圣；你的道就是真理。
verses.en: Sanctify them by the truth; your word is truth.

verses.zh: 你怎样差我到世上，我也照样差他们到世上。
verses.en: As you sent me into the world, I have sent them into the world.

verses.zh: 我为他们的缘故，自己分别为圣，叫他们也因真理成圣。
verses.en: For them I sanctify myself, that they too may be truly sanctified.

verses.zh: 我不但为这些人祈求，也为那些因他们的话信我的人祈求，
verses.en: My prayer is not for them alone. I pray also for those who will believe in me through their message,

verses.zh: 使他们都合而为一。正如你父在我里面，我在你里面，使他们也在我们里面，叫世人可以信你差了我来。
verses.en: that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

verses.zh: 你所赐给我的荣耀，我已赐给他们，使他们合而为一，像我们合而为一。
verses.en: I have given them the glory that you gave me, that they may be one as we are one—

verses.zh: 我在他们里面，你在我里面，使他们完完全全地合而为一，叫世人知道你差了我来，也知道你爱他们如同爱我一样。
verses.en: I in them and you in me—so that they may be brought to complete unity. Then the world will know that you sent me and have loved them even as you have loved me.

verses.zh: 父啊，我在哪里，愿你所赐给我的人也同我在那里，叫他们看见你所赐给我的荣耀，就是未有世界以先，你所爱我的荣耀。
verses.en: Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, and to see my glory, the glory you have given me because you loved me before the creation of the world.

verses.zh: 公义的父啊，世人未曾认识你，我却认识你；这些人也知道你差了我来。
verses.en: Righteous Father, though the world does not know you, I know you, and they know that you have sent me.

verses.zh: 我已将你的名指示他们，还要指示他们，使你所爱我的爱在他们里面，我也在他们里面。
verses.en: I have made you known to them, and will continue to make you known in order that the love you have for me may be in them and that I myself may be in them.

verses.zh: 耶稣说了这话，就同门徒出去，过了汲沦溪，在那里有一个园子，他和门徒进去了。
verses.en: When he had finished praying, Jesus left with his disciples and crossed the Kidron Valley. On the other side there was a garden, and he and his disciples went into it.

verses.zh: 卖耶稣的犹大也知道那地方，因为耶稣和门徒屡次在那里聚集。
verses.en: Now Judas, who betrayed him, knew the place, because Jesus had often met there with his disciples.

verses.zh: 犹大领了一队兵，和祭司长并法利赛人的差役，拿着灯笼、火把、兵器，就来到园里。
verses.en: So Judas came to the garden, guiding a detachment of soldiers and some officials from the chief priests and the Pharisees. They were carrying torches, lanterns and weapons.

verses.zh: 耶稣知道将要临到他的一切事，就出来对他们说：你们找谁？
verses.en: Jesus, knowing all that was going to happen to him, went out and asked them, Who is it you want?

verses.zh: 他们回答说：找拿撒勒人耶稣。耶稣说：我就是。卖他的犹大也同他们站在那里。
verses.en: Jesus of Nazareth, they replied. I am he, Jesus said. (And Judas the traitor was standing there with them.)

verses.zh: 耶稣一说：我就是，他们就退后倒在地上。
verses.en: When Jesus said, I am he, they drew back and fell to the ground.

verses.zh: 他又问他们说：你们找谁？他们说：找拿撒勒人耶稣。
verses.en: Again he asked them, Who is it you want? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：我已经告诉你们，我就是。你们若找我，就让这些人去吧。
verses.en: I told you that I am he, Jesus answered. If you are looking for me, then let these men go.

verses.zh: 这要应验耶稣从前的话，说：你所赐给我的人，我没有失落一个。
verses.en: This happened so that the words he had spoken would be fulfilled: I have not lost one of those you gave me.

verses.zh: 西门彼得带着一把刀，就拔出来，将大祭司的仆人砍了一刀，削掉他的右耳；那仆人名叫马勒古。
verses.en: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest's servant, cutting off his right ear. (The servant's name was Malchus.)

verses.zh: 耶稣就对彼得说：收刀入鞘吧！我父所给我的杯，我岂可不喝呢？
verses.en: Jesus commanded Peter, Put your sword away! Shall I not drink the cup the Father has given me?

verses.zh: 那队兵和千夫长，并犹太人的差役，就拿住耶稣，把他捆绑了。
verses.en: Then the detachment of soldiers with its commander and the Jewish officials arrested Jesus. They bound him

verses.zh: 先带到亚那面前，因为亚那是本年作大祭司的该亚法的岳父。
verses.en: and brought him first to Annas, who was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.

verses.zh: 这该亚法就是从前向犹太人发议论说：一个人替百姓死是有益的那个。
verses.en: Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jewish leaders that it would be good if one man died for the people.

verses.zh: 西门彼得跟着耶稣，还有一个门徒跟着。那门徒是大祭司所认识的，他就同耶稣进了大祭司的院子。
verses.en: Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus. Because this disciple was known to the high priest, he went with Jesus into the high priest's courtyard,

verses.zh: 彼得却站在门外。大祭司所认识的那个门徒出来，和看门的使女说了一声，就领彼得进去。
verses.en: but Peter had to wait outside at the door. The other disciple, who was known to the high priest, came back, spoke to the servant girl on duty there and brought Peter in.

verses.zh: 那看门的使女对彼得说：你不是这人的门徒吗？他说：我不是。
verses.en: You aren't one of this man's disciples too, are you? she asked Peter. He replied, I am not.

verses.zh: 仆人和差役因为天冷，就生了炭火，站在那里烤火；彼得也同他们站着烤火。
verses.en: It was cold, and the servants and officials stood around a fire they had made to keep warm. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.

verses.zh: 大祭司就以耶稣的门徒和他的教训盘问他。
verses.en: Meanwhile, the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and his teaching.

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：我从来是明明的对世人说话。我常在会堂和殿里，就是犹太人聚集的地方教训人；我在暗地里并没有说什么。
verses.en: I have spoken openly to the world, Jesus replied. I always taught in synagogues or at the temple, where all the Jews come together. I said nothing in secret.

verses.zh: 你为什么问我呢？可以问那听见的人，我对他们说的是什么；我所说的，他们都知道。
verses.en: Why question me? Ask those who heard me. Surely they know what I said.

verses.zh: 耶稣说了这话，旁边站着的一个差役，用手掌打他，说：你这样回答大祭司吗？
verses.en: When Jesus said this, one of the officials nearby slapped him in the face. Is this the way you answer the high priest? he demanded.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：我若说得不是，你可以指证那不是；我若说得是，你为什么打我呢？
verses.en: If I said something wrong, Jesus replied, testify as to what is wrong. But if I spoke the truth, why did you strike me?

verses.zh: 亚那就把耶稣解到大祭司该亚法那里，仍是捆着解去的。
verses.en: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.

verses.zh: 西门彼得正站着烤火，有人对他说：你不是他的门徒吗？彼得不承认，说：我不是。
verses.en: Meanwhile, Simon Peter was still standing there warming himself. So they asked him, You aren't one of his disciples too, are you? He denied it, saying, I am not.

verses.zh: 有大祭司的一个仆人，是彼得削掉耳朵的那人的亲属，说：我不是看见你同他在园子里吗？
verses.en: One of the high priest's servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, challenged him, Didn't I see you with him in the garden?

verses.zh: 彼得又不承认。立时鸡就叫了。
verses.en: Again Peter denied it, and at that moment a rooster began to crow.

verses.zh: 众人将耶稣从该亚法那里往衙门内解去，那时天还早。他们自己却不进衙门，恐怕染了污秽，不能吃逾越节的筵席。
verses.en: Then the Jewish leaders took Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the Roman governor. By now it was early morning, and to avoid ceremonial uncleanness they did not enter the palace, because they wanted to be able to eat the Passover.

verses.zh: 彼拉多就出来，到他们那里，说：你们告这人是做什么呢？
verses.en: So Pilate came out to them and asked, What charges are you bringing against this man?

verses.zh: 他们回答说：这人若不是作恶的，我们就不把他交给你。
verses.en: If he were not a criminal, they replied, we would not have handed him over to you.

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：你们自己带他去，按着你们的律法审问他吧。犹太人说：我们没有杀人的权柄。
verses.en: Pilate said, Take him yourselves and judge him by your own law. But we have no right to execute anyone, they objected.

verses.zh: 这要应验耶稣所说，自己将要怎样死的话。
verses.en: This took place to fulfill what Jesus had said about the kind of death he was going to die.

verses.zh: 彼拉多又进了衙门，叫耶稣来，对他说：你是犹太人的王吗？
verses.en: Pilate then went back inside the palace, summoned Jesus and asked him, Are you the king of the Jews?

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：这话是你自己说的，还是别人论我对你说的呢？
verses.en: Is that your own idea, Jesus asked, or did others talk to you about me?

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：我岂是犹太人呢？你本国的人和祭司长把你交给我。你作了什么事呢？
verses.en: Am I a Jew? Pilate replied. Your own people and chief priests handed you over to me. What is it you have done?

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：我的国不属这世界；我的国若属这世界，我的臣仆必要争战，使我不至于被交给犹太人；只是我的国不属这世界。
verses.en: Jesus said, My kingdom is not of this world. If it were, my servants would fight to prevent my arrest by the Jewish leaders. But now my kingdom is from another place.

verses.zh: 彼拉多就对他说：这样，你是王吗？耶稣回答说：你说我是王。我为此而生，也为此来到世间，特为给真理作见证；凡属真理的人就听我的话。
verses.en: You are a king, then! said Pilate. Jesus answered, You say that I am a king. In fact, the reason I was born and came into the world is to testify to the truth. Everyone on the side of truth listens to me.

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：真理是什么呢？说了这话，又出来到犹太人那里，对他们说：我查不出他有什么罪来。
verses.en: What is truth? retorted Pilate. With this he went out again to the Jews gathered there and said, I find no basis for a charge against him.

verses.zh: 但你们有个规矩，在逾越节要我给你们释放一个人，你们要我给你们释放犹太人的王吗？
verses.en: But it is your custom for me to release to you one prisoner at the time of the Passover. Do you want me to release 'the king of the Jews'?

verses.zh: 他们又喊着说：不要这人，要巴拉巴！这巴拉巴是个强盗。
verses.en: They shouted back, No, not him! Give us Barabbas! Now Barabbas had taken part in an uprising.

verses.zh: 当时彼拉多将耶稣鞭打了。
verses.en: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.

verses.zh: 兵丁用荆棘编作冠冕，戴在他头上，给他穿上紫袍，
verses.en: The soldiers twisted together a crown of thorns and put it on his head. They clothed him in a purple robe

verses.zh: 又挨近他，说：恭喜，犹太人的王啊！他们就用手掌打他。
verses.en: and went up to him again and again, saying, Hail, king of the Jews! And they slapped him in the face.

verses.zh: 彼拉多又出来对众人说：我带他出来见你们，叫你们知道我查不出他有什么罪来。
verses.en: Once more Pilate came out and said to the Jews gathered there, Look, I am bringing him out to you to let you know that I find no basis for a charge against him.

verses.zh: 耶稣出来，戴着荆棘冠冕，穿着紫袍。彼拉多对他们说：你们看这个人！
verses.en: When Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe, Pilate said to them, Here is the man!

verses.zh: 祭司长和差役看见他，就喊着说：钉他十字架！钉他十字架！彼拉多说：你们自己把他钉十字架吧！我查不出他有什么罪来。
verses.en: As soon as the chief priests and their officials saw him, they shouted, Crucify! Crucify! But Pilate answered, You take him and crucify him. As for me, I find no basis for a charge against him.

verses.zh: 犹太人回答说：我们有律法，按那律法，他是该死的，因他以自己为神的儿子。
verses.en: The Jewish leaders insisted, We have a law, and according to that law he must die, because he claimed to be the Son of God.

verses.zh: 彼拉多听见这话，越发害怕。
verses.en: When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid,

verses.zh: 又进衙门，对耶稣说：你是哪里来的？耶稣却不回答。
verses.en: and he went back inside the palace. Where do you come from? he asked Jesus, but Jesus gave him no answer.

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：你不对我说话吗？你岂不知我有权柄释放你，也有权柄把你钉十字架吗？
verses.en: Do you refuse to speak to me? Pilate said. Don't you realize I have power either to free you or to crucify you?

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：若不是从上头赐给你的，你就毫无权柄办我。所以，把我交给你的那人罪更重了。
verses.en: Jesus answered, You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.

verses.zh: 从此彼拉多想要释放耶稣，无奈犹太人喊着说：你若释放这个人，就不是该撒的忠臣。（凡以自己为王的，就是背叛该撒。）
verses.en: From then on, Pilate tried to set Jesus free, but the Jewish leaders kept shouting, If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar. Anyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar.

verses.zh: 彼拉多听见这话，就带耶稣出来，到了一个地方，名叫铺华石处，希伯来话叫各各他，就在那里坐堂。
verses.en: When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge's seat at a place known as the Stone Pavement (which in Aramaic is Gabbatha).

verses.zh: 那是预备节的日子，约有午正。彼拉多对犹太人说：看哪，这是你们的王！
verses.en: It was the day of Preparation of the Passover; it was about noon. Here is your king, Pilate said to the Jews.

verses.zh: 他们喊着说：除掉他！除掉他！钉他在十字架上！彼拉多说：我可以钉你们的王吗？祭司长回答说：除了该撒，我们没有王。
verses.en: But they shouted, Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him! Shall I crucify your king? Pilate asked. We have no king but Caesar, the chief priests answered.

verses.zh: 于是彼拉多将耶稣交给他们去钉十字架。
verses.en: Finally Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified.

verses.zh: 他们就把耶稣带了去。耶稣背着自己的十字架出来，到了一个地方，名叫髑髅地，希伯来话叫各各他。
verses.en: So the soldiers took charge of Jesus. Carrying his own cross, he went out to the place of the Skull (which in Aramaic is called Golgotha).

verses.zh: 在那里钉他在十字架上，还有两个人和他一同钉着，一边一个，耶稣在中间。
verses.en: There they crucified him, and with him two others—one on each side and Jesus in the middle.

verses.zh: 彼拉多又用牌子写了一个标题，钉在十字架上，写的是：犹太人的王，拿撒勒人耶稣。
verses.en: Pilate had a notice prepared and fastened to the cross. It read: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.zh: 有许多犹太人念这标题，因为耶稣被钉十字架的地方与城相近，并且是用希伯来、罗马、希腊三样文字写的。
verses.en: Many of the Jews read this sign, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the sign was written in Aramaic, Latin and Greek.

verses.zh: 犹太人的祭司长对彼拉多说：不要写犹太人的王，要写他自己说我是犹太人的王。
verses.en: The chief priests of the Jews protested to Pilate, Do not write 'The King of the Jews,' but that this man claimed to be king of the Jews.

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：我所写的，我已经写上了。
verses.en: Pilate answered, What I have written, I have written.

verses.zh: 兵丁既然将耶稣钉在十字架上，就拿他的衣服分为四分，每兵一分；又拿那件里衣，这件里衣原来没有缝儿，是上下一片织成的。
verses.en: When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes, dividing them into four shares, one for each of them, with the undergarment remaining. This garment was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.

verses.zh: 他们就彼此说：我们不要撕开，只要拈阄，看谁得着。这要应验经上的话说：他们分了我的外衣，为我的里衣拈阄。兵丁果然这样作了。
verses.en: Let's not tear it, they said to one another. Let's decide by lot who will get it. This happened that the scripture might be fulfilled that said, They divided my clothes among them and cast lots for my garment. So this is what the soldiers did.

verses.zh: 站在耶稣十字架旁边的，有他母亲与他母亲的姐妹，并革罗罢的妻子马利亚，和抹大拉的马利亚。
verses.en: Near the cross of Jesus stood his mother, his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

verses.zh: 耶稣见母亲和他所爱的那门徒站在旁边，就对他母亲说：母亲，看你的儿子！
verses.en: When Jesus saw his mother there, and the disciple whom he loved standing nearby, he said to her, Woman, here is your son,

verses.zh: 又对那门徒说：看你的母亲！从此那门徒就接她到自己家里去了。
verses.en: and to the disciple, Here is your mother. From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.

verses.zh: 这事以后，耶稣知道各样的事已经成了，为要使经上的话应验，就说：我渴了。
verses.en: Later, knowing that everything had now been finished, and so that Scripture would be fulfilled, Jesus said, I am thirsty.

verses.zh: 有一个器皿盛满了醋，放在那里；他们就拿海绒蘸满了醋，绑在牛膝草上，送到他口。
verses.en: A jar of wine vinegar was there, so they soaked a sponge in it, put the sponge on a stalk of the hyssop plant, and lifted it to Jesus' lips.

verses.zh: 耶稣尝了那醋，就说：成了！便低下头，将灵魂交付神了。
verses.en: When Jesus had tasted it, he said, It is finished. With that, he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.

verses.zh: 犹太人因这日是预备日，又因那安息日是个大日，就求彼拉多叫人打断他们的腿，把他们拿去，免得尸首当安息日留在十字架上。
verses.en: Now it was the day of Preparation, and the next day was to be a special Sabbath. Because the Jewish leaders did not want the bodies left on the crosses during the Sabbath, they asked Pilate to have the legs broken and the bodies taken down.

verses.zh: 于是兵丁来，打断了第一个人的腿，又打断那和他同钉第二个人的腿。
verses.en: The soldiers therefore came and broke the legs of the first man who had been crucified with Jesus, and then those of the other.

verses.zh: 来到耶稣那里，见他已经死了，就不打断他的腿。
verses.en: But when they came to Jesus and found that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.

verses.zh: 惟有一个兵拿枪扎他的肋旁，随即有血和水流出来。
verses.en: Instead, one of the soldiers pierced Jesus' side with a spear, bringing a sudden flow of blood and water.

verses.zh: 看见这事的那人就作见证，他的见证也是真的，并且他知道自己所说的是真的，叫你们也可以信。
verses.en: The man who saw it has given testimony, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, and he testifies so that you also may believe.

verses.zh: 这些事成了，为要应验经上的话说：他的骨头一根也不可折断。
verses.en: These things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled: Not one of his bones will be broken,

verses.zh: 又有一句说：他们要仰望自己所扎的人。
verses.en: and, as another scripture says, They will look on the one they have pierced.

verses.zh: 这些事以后，有亚利马太人约瑟，是耶稣的门徒，只因怕犹太人，就暗暗地作门徒。他来求彼拉多，要把耶稣的身体领去。彼拉多允准了，他就来把耶稣的身体领去了。
verses.en: Later, Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate for the body of Jesus. Now Joseph was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly because he feared the Jewish leaders. With Pilate's permission, he came and took the body away.

verses.zh: 又有尼哥底母，就是先前夜里去见耶稣的，带着没药和沉香约有一百斤前来。
verses.en: He was accompanied by Nicodemus, the man who earlier had visited Jesus at night. Nicodemus brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about seventy-five pounds.

verses.zh: 他们就照犹太人殡葬的规矩，把耶稣的身体用细麻布加上香料裹好了。
verses.en: Taking Jesus' body, the two of them wrapped it, with the spices, in strips of linen. This was in accordance with Jewish burial customs.

verses.zh: 因为犹太人的预备日，坟墓又近，他们就把耶稣安放在那里。
verses.en: They placed Jesus there because of the Jewish day of Preparation and since the tomb was nearby.

verses.zh: 七日的第一日清早，天还黑的时候，抹大拉的马利亚来到坟墓那里，看见石头从坟墓挪开了。
verses.en: Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and saw that the stone had been removed from the entrance.

verses.zh: 就跑来见西门彼得和耶稣所爱的那个门徒，对他们说：有人把主从坟墓里挪了去，我们不知道放在哪里。
verses.en: So she came running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, and said, They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they have put him!

verses.zh: 彼得和那门徒就出来，往坟墓那里去。
verses.en: So Peter and the other disciple started for the tomb.

verses.zh: 两个人同跑，那门徒比彼得跑得更快，先到了坟墓。
verses.en: Both were running, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.

verses.zh: 低头往里看，见细麻布还放在那里，只是没有进去。
verses.en: He bent over and looked in at the strips of linen lying there but did not go in.

verses.zh: 西门彼得随后也到了，进坟墓里去，就看见细麻布还放在那里，
verses.en: Then Simon Peter came along behind him and went straight into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen lying there,

verses.zh: 又看见耶稣的裹头巾没有和细麻布放在一处，是另在一处卷着。
verses.en: as well as the cloth that had been wrapped around Jesus' head. The cloth was still lying in its place, separate from the linen.

verses.zh: 先到的那门徒也进去，看见就信了。
verses.en: Finally the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also went inside. He saw and believed.

verses.zh: 因为他们还不明白圣经的意思，就是耶稣必要从死里复活。
verses.en: (They still did not understand from Scripture that Jesus had to rise from the dead.)

verses.zh: 于是两个门徒回自己的住处去了。
verses.en: Then the disciples went back to where they were staying.

verses.zh: 马利亚却站在坟墓外面哭。哭的时候，低头往坟墓里看，
verses.en: Now Mary stood outside the tomb crying. As she wept, she bent over to look into the tomb

verses.zh: 见两个天使，穿着白衣，在安放耶稣身体的地方坐着，一个在头，一个在脚。
verses.en: and saw two angels in white, seated where Jesus' body had been, one at the head and the other at the foot.

verses.zh: 天使对她说：妇人，你为什么哭？她说：因为有人把我主挪了去，我不知道放在哪里。
verses.en: They asked her, Woman, why are you crying? They have taken my Lord away, she said, and I don't know where they have put him.

verses.zh: 说了这话，就转过身来，看见耶稣站在那里，却不知道是耶稣。
verses.en: At this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not realize that it was Jesus.

verses.zh: 耶稣问她说：妇人，为什么哭？你找谁呢？马利亚以为是看园的，就对他说：先生，若是你把他移了去，请告诉我，你把他放在哪里，我便去取他。
verses.en: He asked her, Woman, why are you crying? Who is it you are looking for? Thinking he was the gardener, she said, Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will get him.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：马利亚！马利亚就转过来，用希伯来话对他说：拉波尼！（拉波尼就是夫子的意思。）
verses.en: Jesus said to her, Mary. She turned toward him and cried out in Aramaic, Rabboni! (which means Teacher).

verses.zh: 耶稣说：不要摸我，因我还没有升上去见我的父。你往我弟兄那里去，告诉他们说：我要升上去见我的父，也是你们的父；见我的神，也是你们的神。
verses.en: Jesus said, Do not hold on to me, for I have not yet ascended to the Father. Go instead to my brothers and tell them, 'I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.'

verses.zh: 抹大拉的马利亚就去告诉门徒说：我已经看见了主。他又对我这样说了。
verses.en: Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: I have seen the Lord! And she told them that he had said these things to her.

verses.zh: 那日（就是七日的第一日）晚上，门徒所在的地方，因怕犹太人，门都关了。耶稣来，站在当中，对他们说：愿你们平安！
verses.en: On the evening of that first day of the week, when the disciples were together, with the doors locked for fear of the Jewish leaders, Jesus came and stood among them and said, Peace be with you!

verses.zh: 说了这话，就把手和肋旁指给他们看。门徒看见主，就喜乐了。
verses.en: After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord.

verses.zh: 耶稣又对他们说：愿你们平安！父怎样差遣了我，我也照样差遣你们。
verses.en: Again Jesus said, Peace be with you! As the Father has sent me, I am sending you.

verses.zh: 说了这话，就向他们吹一口气，说：你们受圣灵。
verses.en: And with that he breathed on them and said, Receive the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 你们赦免谁的罪，谁的罪就赦免了；你们留下谁的罪，谁的罪就留下了。
verses.en: If you forgive anyone's sins, their sins are forgiven; if you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven.

verses.zh: 那十二个门徒中，有称为低土马的多马；耶稣来的时候，他没有和他们同在。
verses.en: Now Thomas (also known as Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came.

verses.zh: 那些门徒就对他说：我们已经看见主了。多马却说：我非看见他手上的钉痕，用指头探入那钉痕，又用手探入他的肋旁，我总不信。
verses.en: So the other disciples told him, We have seen the Lord! But he said to them, Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.

verses.zh: 过了八日，门徒又在屋里，多马也和他们同在。门都关了。耶稣来，站在当中，说：愿你们平安！
verses.en: A week later his disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, Peace be with you!

verses.zh: 就对多马说：伸过你的指头来，摸我的手；伸出你的手来，探入我的肋旁。不要疑惑，总要信。
verses.en: Then he said to Thomas, Put your finger here; see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe.

verses.zh: 多马说：我的主！我的神！
verses.en: Thomas said to him, My Lord and my God!

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：你因看见了我才信；那没有看见就信的有福了。
verses.en: Then Jesus told him, Because you have seen me, you have believed; blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.

verses.zh: 耶稣在门徒面前另外行了许多神迹，没有记在这书上。
verses.en: Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not recorded in this book.

verses.zh: 但记这些事，要叫你们信耶稣是基督，是神的儿子，并且叫你们信了他，就可以因他的名得生命。
verses.en: But these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.

verses.zh: 你们必晓得真理，真理必叫你们得以自由。
verses.en: Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.

verses.zh: 盗贼来，无非要偷窃、杀害、毁坏；我来了，是要叫羊得生命，并且得的更丰盛。
verses.en: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.

verses.zh: 我是好牧人，好牧人为羊舍命。
verses.en: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

verses.zh: 耶稣对她说：复活在我，生命也在我！信我的人，虽然死了，也必复活。
verses.en: Jesus said to her, I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die.

verses.zh: 我赐给你们一条新命令，乃是叫你们彼此相爱；我怎样爱你们，你们也要怎样相爱。
verses.en: A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：我就是道路、真理、生命，若不藉着我，没有人能到父那里去。
verses.en: Jesus answered, I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

verses.zh: 我留下平安给你们，我将我的平安赐给你们；我所赐的，不像世人所赐的，你们心里不要忧愁，也不要胆怯。
verses.en: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.

verses.zh: 我是葡萄树，你们是枝子；常在我里面的，我也常在他里面，这人就多结果子，因为离了我，你们就不能做什么。
verses.en: I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.

verses.zh: 我将这些事告诉你们，是要叫你们在我里面有平安。在世上你们有苦难，但你们可以放心，我已经胜了世界。
verses.en: I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.

verses.zh: 认识你独一的真神，并且认识你所差来的耶稣基督，这就是永生。
verses.en: Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.

verses.zh: 耶稣尝了那醋，就说：成了！便低下头，将灵魂交付神了。
verses.en: When he had received the drink, Jesus said, It is finished. With that, he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.

verses.zh: 耶稣又对他们说：愿你们平安！父怎样差遣了我，我也照样差遣你们。
verses.en: Again Jesus said, Peace be with you! As the Father has sent me, I am sending you.

verses.zh: 但记这些事，要叫你们信耶稣是基督，是神的儿子，并且叫你们信了他，就可以因他的名得生命。
verses.en: But these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
